intro: Borreria paulista, commonly known as Brazilian burr bush, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its woody stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces small, hard fruits that contain seeds, which are dispersed by animals. Borreria paulista is often found in dry, open habitats such as savannas and rocky areas. Its adaptability to harsh conditions makes it an important component of its native ecosystems.
